content:
Diagnosis:	WHO Grade I secretory meningioma, right frontal convexity

Management:	15 March 2023 Simpson Grade 1 resection

Histology:	Secretory meningioma WHO Grade I, Ki-67 3%, PR positive

Current Situation:	Routine surveillance

[redacted name] attended neurosurgical-oncology follow-up clinic today. She remains clinically well with no new neurological symptoms. Her previous mild headaches have resolved completely. She continues to work full-time and maintains an active lifestyle. No focal neurological deficits on examination. Latest MRI brain (15/4/24) shows post-operative changes only with no evidence of recurrence. The plan is to continue annual MRI surveillance as per protocol. Next scan due April 2025 with follow-up appointment to be arranged thereafter. Patient understands to contact us sooner if any new symptoms develop.

cancer_timeline.value: MRI brain shows post-operative changes only with no evidence of recurrence

patient_facts.value: continues to work full-time and maintains an active lifestyle
MRI brain 15/4/24 shows post-operative changes only with no evidence of recurrence

status_updates.value: WHO Grade I secretory meningioma status post complete resection. Stable on surveillance with no evidence of recurrence

follow-up appointment to be arranged after next MRI scan
